TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ListBindingConverter extends System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert objects to and from various other representations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBindingConverter> is used to evaluate and convert a property of an object into a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Binding>.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverterAttribute> is applied to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Binding> class with the type of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBindingConverter> as an argument.
For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/90373a3f-d8c8-492d-841c-945d62393c56).
> [!NOTE] > You should never create an instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBindingConverter> class. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.
